title: >>> When the YOUNG Stay YOUNG
body_text:
A second week of birthday festivites! Streamers were blowing and smiles were glowing as one-fourth of the most dominant dodgeball family got his chance to rule the sport as he saw fit ... Chris Adams!
>> Juan Londono & John Tronolone vs. Kevin Megill & Chris Adams
After last week's defeat, one just knew the eldest Adams was looking for revenge on his new found foe Juan. Adding John Tronolone to the mix could only sweeten the pot if Chris did indeed come out victorious. So you have a two man "John" team ready for war and what do you do? Choose the one and only Kevin Megill as your partner.
An all-star main event with the stipulation and gametype yet to be decided. One could have only wondered what the powerhouse would have up his sleeve.
>> Box Ball Dodgeball
Picture this: two teams, captained by two men, split in half. Confusing so far? Now imagine opponents adjacent on both your right and left, with teammates diagonally across. The dodge balls were placed in a gabage can, put between the two nets at the center line, as competitors raced from their respective corners in hopes of snatching a weapon.
Through the initial turmoil, let's be honest ... one the most entertaining bouts in history.
Tom and Kevin Adams joined their birthday brother to slaughter their adversaries game after game. With one Kevin Megill fighting on the diagonal court, Team JUAN JOHN stood no chance against the masses. After about Game 3, the night was clearly lost for JUAN JOHN having been annihilated in just minutes time.
Talk about gaining a measure of revenge, how's 14 to
zero
sound? Add in three traditional style games, and you have the biggest slaughter in the history of dodgeball: 17 - 0!
No Walker Needed
: The single biggest threat of the night had to have been Chris Adams himself. It took 12 games to eliminate the multi-time award winner. Thanks to nemesis Kevin Fitzpatrick, he suffered only 2 eliminations during the entire 3 hour-plus event.
....
"Whether I won seventeen games in a row or lost seventeen games in a row, this was easily one of the most fun nights I've had because the action was nonstop, the gameplay was new and refreshing, and everyones' enthusiasm was really great. I'd like to play a game like this again when we have a few dozen people come this spring and summer."
- CHRIS ADAMS
....
Moments
: The red wagon carting around the cake, Chris Adams "breakdance" dodge midway through, John Tronolone receiving his first nutshot ever at the hands of Kevin Adams, Steve Adams defecting to Team JUAN JOHN.
RECORDS SECTION
> Attendance: 22
> Biggest Return: Meredith Lewis (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 71)
> New Players: 0
- Comedically subtitled "When the YOUNG grow OLD", DODGEBALL 79 celebrated Chris Adams's 25th birthday.
- Because of the special occasion, Chris was given full booking power over the event; choosing captains, gametype, and stipulations.
- This was the first afternoon event since DODGEBALL 43 in mid-June 2006.
- DODGEBALL 79 witnessed the debut of "Box Ball Dodgeball". Two full tennis courts were needed, with fire from the right and left sides of the court.
- This was the first event played on the back courts since the Invasion of DODGEBALL LX3, as well as the return of Human rims. This was actually due to tennis players on the front courts.
- The captains for 79 pitted Juan Londono and John Tronolone against Kevin Megill and Chris Adams himself. Juan is 1-1, John is 3-5, Kevin is 3-0, and Chris is 5-4.
- Without question, the biggest "slaughter victory" in history; 17-0 in favor of Kevin Megill and the birthday boy. Interestingly enough, this was the third slaughter in four weeks.
- Notables from 79 include cake, drinks, streamers, and though windy, the warm spring weather.
THANKS!
Thanks to everyone who brought food, most notably Melissa Kerr and Mike "Sputz" for the giant cake. Steve Adams also brought several packs of Lipton green tea.
Lenny Herrera, Mike "Sputz", and John Tronolone set up the streamers, so thanks are in order to them as well.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
DODGEBALL 80
It's March Madness! The biggest event of the year concludes this incredible 8th Season of dodgeball. Do not miss out on this one time only extravanganza, headlined by a mega match:
Two contrasting styles go head-to-head when the powerful, undefeated
Kevin Megill
takes on the high-flyin' dodging expert
Mike Edwards
.
The biggest spectacle of 2007!
body_html:
A second week of birthday festivites! Streamers were blowing and smiles were glowing as one-fourth of the most dominant dodgeball family got his chance to rule the sport as he saw fit ... Chris Adams!

>> Juan Londono & John Tronolone vs. Kevin Megill & Chris Adams
After last week's defeat, one just knew the eldest Adams was looking for revenge on his new found foe Juan. Adding John Tronolone to the mix could only sweeten the pot if Chris did indeed come out victorious. So you have a two man "John" team ready for war and what do you do? Choose the one and only Kevin Megill as your partner.

An all-star main event with the stipulation and gametype yet to be decided. One could have only wondered what the powerhouse would have up his sleeve.

>> Box Ball Dodgeball
Picture this: two teams, captained by two men, split in half. Confusing so far? Now imagine opponents adjacent on both your right and left, with teammates diagonally across. The dodge balls were placed in a gabage can, put between the two nets at the center line, as competitors raced from their respective corners in hopes of snatching a weapon.

Through the initial turmoil, let's be honest ... one the most entertaining bouts in history.

Tom and Kevin Adams joined their birthday brother to slaughter their adversaries game after game. With one Kevin Megill fighting on the diagonal court, Team JUAN JOHN stood no chance against the masses. After about Game 3, the night was clearly lost for JUAN JOHN having been annihilated in just minutes time.

Talk about gaining a measure of revenge, how's 14 to zero sound? Add in three traditional style games, and you have the biggest slaughter in the history of dodgeball: 17 - 0!

No Walker Needed: The single biggest threat of the night had to have been Chris Adams himself. It took 12 games to eliminate the multi-time award winner. Thanks to nemesis Kevin Fitzpatrick, he suffered only 2 eliminations during the entire 3 hour-plus event.

....

"Whether I won seventeen games in a row or lost seventeen games in a row, this was easily one of the most fun nights I've had because the action was nonstop, the gameplay was new and refreshing, and everyones' enthusiasm was really great. I'd like to play a game like this again when we have a few dozen people come this spring and summer."
- CHRIS ADAMS

....

Moments: The red wagon carting around the cake, Chris Adams "breakdance" dodge midway through, John Tronolone receiving his first nutshot ever at the hands of Kevin Adams, Steve Adams defecting to Team JUAN JOHN.

RECORDS SECTION
> Attendance: 22
> Biggest Return: Meredith Lewis (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 71)
> New Players: 0

- Comedically subtitled "When the YOUNG grow OLD", DODGEBALL 79 celebrated Chris Adams's 25th birthday.
- Because of the special occasion, Chris was given full booking power over the event; choosing captains, gametype, and stipulations.
- This was the first afternoon event since DODGEBALL 43 in mid-June 2006.
- DODGEBALL 79 witnessed the debut of "Box Ball Dodgeball". Two full tennis courts were needed, with fire from the right and left sides of the court.
- This was the first event played on the back courts since the Invasion of DODGEBALL LX3, as well as the return of Human rims. This was actually due to tennis players on the front courts.
- The captains for 79 pitted Juan Londono and John Tronolone against Kevin Megill and Chris Adams himself. Juan is 1-1, John is 3-5, Kevin is 3-0, and Chris is 5-4.
- Without question, the biggest "slaughter victory" in history; 17-0 in favor of Kevin Megill and the birthday boy. Interestingly enough, this was the third slaughter in four weeks.
- Notables from 79 include cake, drinks, streamers, and though windy, the warm spring weather.

THANKS!
Thanks to everyone who brought food, most notably Melissa Kerr and Mike "Sputz" for the giant cake. Steve Adams also brought several packs of Lipton green tea.

Lenny Herrera, Mike "Sputz", and John Tronolone set up the streamers, so thanks are in order to them as well.

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

DODGEBALL 80

It's March Madness! The biggest event of the year concludes this incredible 8th Season of dodgeball. Do not miss out on this one time only extravanganza, headlined by a mega match:




Two contrasting styles go head-to-head when the powerful, undefeated Kevin Megill takes on the high-flyin' dodging expert Mike Edwards.

The biggest spectacle of 2007!
